alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:36PM EDT until July 12 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by continued runoff from earlier rain. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Grafton. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways will continue overnight despite the rainfall moving out. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM EDT, Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from earlier rain. Additional showers are likely overnight, but amounts should remain under and inch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Grafton, Hanover, Enfield, Canaan, Groton, Piermont, Lyme, Dorchester and Orford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
